direction.raw_text: : Black indeed. Deep. Empty. Out of the darkness, we hear a NEWS COMMENTATOR. Voice scratchy. Indistinct. Far away or long ago...

direction.raw_text: fills the screen. Black and white. Grainy. The legend: BELFAST, NORTHERN IRELAND, over footage of a sidewalk bombing. We're back in time, the year 1971. A crisp- looking BRIGADIER is speaking to the off-camera reporter:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An ANNOUNCER's face replaces him:

dialogue.raw_text: ...the bombing has been linked to the Ulster Volunteer Force, which, as you know, is the counterpart of the provisional IRA and the most violent of the Protestant Paramilitary groups.

dialogue.raw_text: Despite threats of reprisals, Brigadier Baltimore repeats that he will seek to cut UVF supply lines, especially from Tripoli, Lybia. U.S. President Nixon concurs that...

direction.raw_text: A battered TV, volume turned low. Snoozing in a chair, a rumpled older man -- It's the BRIGADIER, the one we just saw speaking on TV. A CALENDAR on the table identifies the date as June 23, 1971.

direction.raw_text: Girlish decor. Pinups of rock stars. A YOUNG GIRL is awake, dressed and currently stuffing two pillows under a blanket. She inspects her handiwork. Human-looking lump. Turns, satisfied. One last look at the WOODEN JESUS on the wall -- Creeps from the room. Past the sleeping Brigadier. To the front door. She checks over her shoulder, nervous. Taps out five digits. Shuts off the alarm. Unlocks the door and slips out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy's name is GREGORY. Sixteen, with a quick, easy grin. Huddled beneath a tree with him, the girl is gelatin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slides a hand under her sweater. She stiffens, terrified and exhilarated, as he gently strokes her nipple with a thumb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leans in. She leans forward. A jerky, tentative duckling on the road to swan-dom. Their lips touch. Across the road, THE WINDOWS BLOW OUT in her father's flat. She spins, scream caught in her throat -- as ARMED MEN rush from the house. Through the door, the one she left unlocked. Stutter of SMALL ARMS FIRE. She whirls on Gregory, realizes only then that the guy is LAUGHING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slaps her full across the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He spins and flees.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You've never made it with a boy, then?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's nothing odd about it. I'm only sixteen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Saw him on the telly. Think he'd kill me? I'm a nasty one, I am.

dialogue.raw_text: You know what, I'll bet you've never even kissed a boy... now, have you? (beat) Aye, but you want to...

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks for shutting off the alarm, you bloody Papist bitch.

dialogue.raw_text: Tell the press the Ulster Force claims full credit.

direction.raw_text: Girl, moving. Walls racing past, shot to PIECES, run run run into her bedroom and LURCHES to a stop, screaming:

direction.raw_text: Propped against the wall. By the bed. He's still alive. Incredibly. The man has DRAGGED himself in here. He refused to die, simply couldn't, you see... Not until he reached his daughter.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: *DA*!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Two pillows, jammed beneath a blanket. The Brigadier just stares at them. His face slack. White and gastly. Shifts his gaze to his daughter. Tears running from his dulled eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He raises the pistol to his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He fires. On a young girl's dissolve into insanity we FADE OUT... Sound, echoing away. Blackness, total.

dialogue.raw_text: How much...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...did they pay you...?

direction.raw_text: Waking is slow. Samantha opens her eyes. Blinks. Hazy, out of focus. Tries to rub her eyes, can't. Hands. Something's wrong, what the hell'd she do with her hands...? Ah. They're stretched over her head. BOUND WITH CORD. Suddenly she's very awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The basement of the old converted mill. A drafty, windswept place full of old, broken timbers. A river runs through it. A stream, at any rate. The waters are still and frozen now. Above the stream -- A GREAT WOODEN WHEEL. Smaller corollary of the wheel outside. Mounted on the same axis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is tied to that wheel. Lashed to its SIDE, affixed to it like a goddess to a Greek sailing ship. Now the bad news, the ice has been chopped away so the wheel can TURN... And it will plunge Samantha UNDER THE FREEZING WATER. Beneath the ice. Bound hand and foot. Strapped to the wheel, wearing only a nightgown, she is utterly helpless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (AKA Luke) stands before her, giving instructions to the ubiquitous TIMOTHY. He looks up at Samantha. Seeing her eyelids flutter, he tosses her a cherry wave. Gone is the gee-whiz country boy schtick; in its place, a frightening arrogance. He tosses her his cheeriest wave:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha struggles against her bonds. No dice. Subsides. Takes a look around at her predicament. TIMOTHY stands at the edge of the ice. Watching her intently. Smiles thinly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daedalus shakes his head, frowning:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He crosses toward a large RED BUTTON. Set into a wooden beam. Samantha thrashes at the bindings. Looks down at the water where it intercepts the mammoth wheel. Fighting panic:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hits the button. An electric WHINE -- THE BIG WHEEL TURNS. Feet first into the water. Struggling. Arms stretched above her head. She plunges below the surface. A new dimension in PAIN. Frozen, mind-numbing. She WRITHES against the wheel. It's like a crushing VICE is ripping her limb from limb. She opens her eyes, briefly. Discovers she's not alone -- A mere foot from her face, THE BLOATED CORPSE of the drowned NATHAN. Staring away and away. Blue with cyanosis. Meanwhile, back ON THE SURFACE: Daedalus turns to his right- hand man, who says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns. Hits the red button again. THE WHEEL reverses itself. Creaks and moans, turning -- SAMANTHA BREAKS THE SURFACE. Gasping for air. Wheezing. Choking. The FREEZING WIND plasters the nightgown to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samantha, face twisted. Coughs. Wheezes. TIMOTHY looks her in the eye... shakes his head:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He exits. Daedalus, alone with his captive. On her features, unbridled HATRED. He chuckles:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shakes his head, makes a "tsk tsk" gesture. Smiles grimly as he turns his attention to the red switch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without warning, her head snaps upward -- Eyes cold. Voice, not her own:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hits the button. She plunges beneath the surface. Daedalus walks over to one corner. Sits down. Takes out a pipe. Lights it. Picks up a book. Reads. And reads.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, good afternoon. If it isn't the forgetful spy. How you feeling?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not-so fresh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You... you're... the man from the bar...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not that I don't trust my compatriot, Colonel Baltimore. In fact, I had every confidence that your amnesia was genuine -- until you showed up *here*. You follow? (beat) Meanwhile, I just got around to reading the papers, there's the small matter of an incident upstate. Long range rifle shot, blew a man out of his socks. (coldly) You can see where I'm coming from. I'm trying to pull of the biggest job of my career. I have to know. How much you really remember... and who you've told.

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't tell a soul, I swear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Torture, yes. The torturing of beautiful women, albeit politically incorrect, is an addiction with me. (beat) A woman never looks quite so beautiful as when her face is distended in pain. Witness the beauty of childbirth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please, I'm getting all misty. Look, untie me, I'll make any face you want.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's not, and say we did. Do you smoke?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Smoke...? Um, no. Not... not really.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good. You'll last longer. Now hush yourself, and take a deep breath. We're gonna do the torture thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're running on schedule, I just secured the tanker. We're borrowing it from Carbide in South Carolina. Cargo listed as fire retardant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) Juice up the bird, we head out soon as I'm done here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take all the air you can, that's right. If you need to vomit, do it now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't remember *at all*...? The greatest night of your life, shit, drown this ungrateful wench.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Talk to me Colonel. Is my identity safe...? The truth, and I'll shoot you in the head. Nice and quick. Otherwise, you're in for a long night. *Who did you talk to*?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Nobody... fuck you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hate to see you like this, Charly. I heard you were a helluva spy once.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Watch your back. I'm not done yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's a very funny joke. You're an entertaining woman. Good night.

direction.raw_text: -- Sam THRASHES and jerks, to and fro. Dead Nathan, mocking her. There, under the water, the memories come... In a flood. Stark and vivid.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE YEAR THE TRUNK OF A CAR

direction.raw_text: - THE YEAR THE TRUNK OF A CAR opens, revealing a patch of night sky. Mostly obscured by two familiar individuals -- There's ONE-EYED JACK, remember him? Few years younger. One eyeball heavier. The other man is TIMOTHY. He looks in the trunk. Nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lid SLAMS SHUT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, I'll signal Daedalus. Your money will be waiting, and Jack...? Do yourself a favor, do her and dump her, I'm serious. Don't get cute, try to play doctor first. I made that mistake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The world of rushing MADNESS, memories unspooling now, faster and faster -- MEMORY FLASH: A CLIFF overlooking the ocean. Darkness. Sheeting rain. Our heroine (for it is unquestionably SAMANTHA) is lying unconscious atop a rocky bluff. Drenched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: produces a SYRINGE from a leather case. Rolls up her sleeve. Starts to administer the injection. Stops. He can't resist... Can't help LOOSENING the buttons on her shirt. Her eyes snap open. And before it even registers, she's grabbed the hypodermic and plunged it deep INTO HIS EYE -- Then she's up and running. Along the cliff, toward the car... Jack, HOWLING in pain, stumbling... Draws his gun and shoots her. In the head. She pitches backward. Tumbles from the cliff...! Rushes headlong toward the waters below, getting smaller -- INT. BASEMENT OF OLD MILL - THE PRESENT Here. Now. She breaks the surface. Gasping for breath. SHRIEKS, a sound ripped from her by the PAIN, the COLD -- By her ruptured sanity. She hangs there. Drenched. Half frozen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: can't help it. A chill dances up his spine, watching... She is not afraid. She is not whimpering. She is looking directly AT HIM. With a sick smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daedalus struggles to recover his poise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charly's eyes bore into his:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daedalus stabs the red button. THE BIG WHEEL TURNS... Into the water goes Charly. Going down for the third time.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Daedalus... Make you a deal... Let me go now...? I'll leave you the use of your legs... Bargain, trust me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How did you find me? Who knows about this place, WHO HAVE YOU TOLD?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I let you touch me, cowboy... I think I need a bath.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - HELL - SAME Here we are again, in the world of silence and blinding PAIN. Despair and madness but now there's something else -- Now there's RAGE. It takes losing most of the FLESH from her right wrist... But she frees the hand. WRENCHES it loose. The water turns soupy red around it. GROPES, blindly. Fingers NUMB, so fucking cold -- Breath, running out. No air. NO TIME. She darts her right hand forward. Toward the obscenely bobbing CORPSE of Nathan. Does something grotesque, jams her hand DOWN THE CORPSE'S PANTS -- Hideaway gun, it's right where he said, right beside Mr. Wally. PSP-25. Semi-auto, steel jackets. She waits. Rage inside her. Death in her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wheel CREAKS. Groans. The terrorist in the western boots watches her emerge, face first -- She comes up firing. The first slug takes him in the knee. Blows it to scraps. He collapses, howling. She shifts aim. THE RED BUTTON. No hesitation. BLAM-! Hits it DEAD ON. Stops the wheel. Incredible. Doesn't blink. Unties her captive hand. BLOWS TO SPLINTERS the wood surrounding her feet. Leaps to solid ground, as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daedalus looks up from his prone position. In agony. A vision from Hell approaches: A fiendish blue-skinned woman in a sodden nightgown. Blood leaking from one wrist. She has risen, REBORN, from the icy waters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She shoots him in the other knee. He HOWLS. Gun, empty. She tosses it aside. In a nearby crate: ASSAULT RIFLES. Snatches up a Kalashnikov and clip. Kneels and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She fires again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Samantha... Please...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's Samantha?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You see in the movies, badguy says, "Talk to me and I'll let you live." We're gonna run a variation, it goes like this: Talk to me...? I'll let you die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's Henessey...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The detective lies naked, bound hand and foot. Beaten. FREEZING. A single ray of LIGHT through a tiny crack. He hears a SPLINTERING noise, as if a door's been ripped from its hinges. Pause -- A FUSILLADE of gunfire. Shouts, cries. A heavy weight SLAMS to the floorboards above him. Through a crack comes a tiny stream of BLOOD, dribbling onto him, as -- EXT. OLD MILL - SAME TIME TIMOTHY bolts from the house, clutching a bleeding hand. Running hellbent for leather. Reaches a parked car. Leaps in and kicks over the engine as, behind him -- MORE MEN come piling out of the house, shouting. Running for their cars -- never make it. CUT DOWN IN THEIR TRACKS. Wracked by gunfire, bodies twitching... And as Timothy PEELS OUT, spraying mud, we pull UP, UP, AND AWAY... Into the sky, moving ever higher, gunfire fading... Until now we're WAY UP, we can see Timothy's car... the OLD MILL, ever so tiny below us... It blows to pieces. Sends flaming boards flying STRAIGHT UP AT US.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door bursts open as PERKINS stalks in, shedding his coat. His aide -- let's call him HARRY -- looks up nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He throws open a door off the passage: THERE'S TIMOTHY. Perched on the edge of a conference table, tamping a pack of smokes. Perkins reacts, stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He blows smoke. Trains his eyes on the older man. Piercing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: *You*...! Are you crazy, coming here??

dialogue.raw_text: Perkins.

dialogue.raw_text: It's cold, I want to come in.

dialogue.raw_text: Charly...? Oh, my God, what the hell are you *doing*? Listen to me, I'm going to direct you to a safe house, get you on a plane -- CHARLY Can the bullshit, I'm not telling you where I am. I'll come in for a full debriefing, but we do it my way.

direction.raw_text: Waking is slow for Mitch Henessey. He swallows dryly. Eyes creak open, struggle to focus... Hears WATER running. A shower. Squints at his watch. He's not wearing a watch, he knew that... In BED, naked. Chest swathed in bandages, what the hell...? He pokes them. Jerks his head, hissing in pain.

direction.raw_text: Henessey lights a smoke at the bar. Flicks the match in a trashcan. Starts to go, stops... Reaches into the can. Plucks out a tiny scrap: PHOTOGRAPH, ripped in two. A photo of Hal and Caitlin. He pockets it, disturbed. Crosses to the bathroom door. The shower has stopped. Raises a tentative hand, starts to knock... It OPENS. There, in a thin silk robe, is a WOMAN, swabbing at her hair. She breezes out of the bathroom all chipper, like nothing's unusual. Notices Henessey cursorily. Raises a finger: "one sec." Lowers her head and shakes it like a terrier, spraying him. He cannot stop staring. It's Samantha, it *has* to be... Now she's BLONDE, though. Hair clipped short. Bobbed. Blood- red fingernails. Red cotton shift, legs for days. Then, she *smiles* at him -- and it's not her, not Samantha. Amnesia's over, folks, because we're clearly looking at a changed woman: This one's name is CHARLY BALTIMORE, and she hasn't seen the light of day in eight years.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got him.

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus wept.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: hurtles forward, SPEED SKATING across the frozen pond toward the chase vehicles. Long, coltish legs, to die for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She goes SIDESLIPPING at superhuman speed. Tacks alongside the government sedan. Targets the bald guy's head. Raises the .45 and FIRES. Not to be graphic, but the car's driver receives the bulk of the mess. SPRAYED. Across the eyes. He loses control, SKIDS OUT. Catapults off the road, onto the ice. Slides right toward Charly, *still doing fifty*... She doesn't miss a beat. LAUNCHES herself, twisting in midair... Up OVER THE HOOD of the sedan, it blows by underneath her as
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is gross, this is gonna be so Goddamn gross...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The incredible part. In slow motion, she does a DOUBLE AXEL PIRHOUETTE. Above the hood. Mid-spin, she blows THREE SHOTS through the windshield. Kills everyone. Keeps going. The car spins twice around. PLOWS to a halt -- Charly hits a picture perfect landing. On the shore, HENESSEY watches, thunderstruck. Charly skates by the icebound sedan. Flashes a grin at the dying driver:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She delivers a blow to the neck. Kills him. CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Shit... it really... *is* you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Phil...? Phil Krauss? I don't believe it, they moved you from cyphers. Long time, man, I figured you were dead by now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Henessey and Charly, driving a new vehicle: late model Cadillac. Charly driver. Henessey rifles the glove compartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a short, CHIRPING sound. Seemingly from nowhere. They exchange puzzled looks, what the hell...? Charly abruptly realizes it's coming from her purse. She reaches in, scoops up the CELLULAR PHONE, the one she told Caitlin to call. Thumbs the button. Says cautiously:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A voice, then... Clipped tones, TIMOTHY'S voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charly. Hand gripped tight on the phone. Pause, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he rips open the bill we CUT TO: A neutral background, as Charly's HEAD enters frame, we're very tight on her FACE... Tense, thin-lipped. A PHONE RINGS, deafening. Click -- Charly speaks tersely:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So, Mitch. Still think I'm warm and fuzzy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure. It's not your fault the gun accidentally went off in mid-air as you tripped and flew over the car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Exactly. What's in the glove box?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Phone bill, Christmas card... Five buck, swell. You didn't have to kill him, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Back off, man. Do I tell you how to snap photos of extramarital blowjobs? No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) It's me, I got your kid. Give your location, we gotta lose the cellular.

dialogue.raw_text: State Road 80, 15 minutes west of Harrison.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, here's how we do it. Drive to Harrison, find their main bus stop. Pay phone, fifteen minutes. Better drive fast, after five rings I hang up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell was that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's got the kid. Doesn't want to talk on the airwaves, he's routing me to a land line. A pay phone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Which phone? Where?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shit. Service centers...! They list 'em on the back of phone bills, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up and find me a gun. HK, MP-5.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Verify you have her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I got your cellular number off a cast on her right wrist. Right below Mommy loves you... Picture of a panda. Dog, panda, it's got funky ears.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : Dead still. Made of glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs up. Dead silence. HOLD on Charly's face... until slowly, ever so slowly, the camera pulls back to REVEAL: The .45 automatic -- Pointed at the head of an AT&T operator. THE PHONE COMPANY, they've taken it over. Employees CRINGE on the floor. Henessey, MP-5 slung on his shoulder, leveled. Charly points to the switchboard:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I want money, Charly. I know you've got numbered accounts, we all do. I'll let you know where and when. Fuck with me...? I'll blind the kid and shoot out her knees.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're dead, motherfucker. We don't involve families. It's not the way it's done, *we don't take families*.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be in touch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give me an ANI trace. Do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Set back from the mountain road, a lonely MOTEL. A neon sign: *Deer Lick Motel*, No vacancies. The sign sits atop a rusty pole. Blinks forlornly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hangs up and turns to MR. PERKINS, seated across the room:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perkins crosses to the bed. Rubs tired eyes. Gazes down at Caitlin. Asleep, a syringe on the nightstand beside her. Next to a brown paper bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perkins follows his gaze: the brown paper bag. Smiles thinly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches into the paper bag and brings out a BABY DOLL. Sweet, innocent. Frilly with lace. A bright red bow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's done, she hooked. All I gotta do is set the ransom meet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She mustn't suspect a trap.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No way. She thinks I'm acting alone, remember? Say the word, I'll hand her to you on a plate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God. We're monsters, aren't we...? (pause, then:) Forget Charly. Talk to me about tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The tanker's on its way from Charleston, ETA 1:00 a.m. One terrorist on ice, waiting to play patsy. (points) What's in the sack?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That...? Something to prove that I'm not a complete ogre.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See? The young one will have a doll to play with on Christmas. Very popular item. It... well, it pees. You put water in it and... oh, fuck you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Charly and Henessey, eating at HARDEE'S. Seated across from each other at an orange plastic table, scarfing Christmas burgers. Outside, a billboard reads: WELCOME TO SANTA CLAUS! *Where it's Christmas all year long*!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She knows she's shocking him, rubs it in:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The look in her eyes is feral.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Almost dark now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Another ten minutes. You want my Crazy Meal action figure?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pass. Listen, you sure we're doing the right thing? We've got money, we could negotiate...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: *I'll get the damn kid*, okay? God, I hope he doesn't shoot her up. Kid's dead weight if she's sedated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not so emotional, I'm getting embarrassed with these outbursts here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, balls. Want me to cry on cue? I can. This is an extraction, nimrod, and she's the target, that's how to play it, the only way to beat this guy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah? How come you know so much about this fucking guy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't go there, Mitch, you don't want to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm here. Suppose you tell me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine, you asked. I bumped pelvises with this guy. In Paris, back in 1987.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd been assigned to kill his boss, remember...? Needed him out of the way. So I let him seduce me. Had a steel needle under the pillow, figured to stick him *en flagrante*, that means while we were screwing. But he was too slick. Bashed me in the head, finished, then threw me in the trunk of a car. Still think I'm a girl scout, Mitch...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's almost dark. Let's get it done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Full dark now, the fun begins... A TANKER TRUCK rumbles up the mountain road. Pulls up before the Deer Lick Motel. MEN IN SUITS wield flashlights, motioning the truck forward into a cavernous GARAGE. Inside, men in BLUE JUMPSUITS operate cranes, maneuver a FILL TANK into place above the truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the distance, as the tanker enters the garage -- CHARLY BALTIMORE drops into frame. Lands and rolls, cat-quick. Comes up behind a scrawny pine. Scans through a pair of Zeiss Nightvision binoculars. Welcome to the extraction. No more fun and games, tonight it's a survival-zero operation. HENESSEY appears at her elbow. Lugging the ordnance bag. He sees Charly lower the binoculars, head in hands.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fucking Chapter, that's who. Timothy acting alone, Caitlin had a chance. Now...? She's dead meat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As the tanker snorts to a halt, TIMOTHY pulls up, driving a bright red Jaguar. Gets out as a blue-suit trots up:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: hours. We're still trying to clean the tanker -- TIMOTHY (scowls annoyance) Fuck the cleaning, just drain it and reload. Chop-chop, I'm going bunjee jumping after this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Charly and Henessey. Kneeling. He speaks tersely:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charly studies the encampment. Armed men. Impossible odds. Draws a long ragged breath and flops on the ground. Props her back against a tree. Staring. Lights a cigarette:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks up at the sky. Face troubled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She heaves a sigh. Threads a silencer on a baretta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henessey nods. Pause -- she does something unexpected. Leans over and kisses him hard on the lips. He reacts, startled. She pulls back, the oddest look on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She kisses him again. Softly. Tenderly. Pulls back, turns without a word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She moves off toward the trees. Henessey shifts from foot to foot, awkwardly. Opens his mouth -- CHARLY Don't say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's gone, like a wraith. CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Let me go in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Negative. You stomp around like a forties drunk and you're a lousy shot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I get by.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You couldn't hit a lake if you were standing on the bottom, now shut the fuck up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw a little girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (frowns) Come again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what happened under the water. That night, eight years ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At the end... there she was, this pretty little girl at the bottom of the ocean, smiling at me. Three years old, didn't know Daddies hid in closets, not yet. Stared up at me in the strangest way... saying how'd it come to this, we were so pretty and perfect, now look at us, sinking with our head all open... Said when she grew up she was gonna teach school. She couldn't wait.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guards are on 27-1 megahertz, meet me at 26-9, you need to talk. As soon as you spot me with the kid, start blowing the charges.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're gonna blow my head off, you know. (softly:) This is the last time I'll ever be pretty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Time now. What I do next, they tell me it... looks like a machine or something. You don't like it, don't look.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was gonna say enjoy life, eat out more often.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gotta go. (beat) If she's alive, she's coming out of there, Mitch. If she's not... they'll know we stopped by.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : Charly, on the prowl. In and out of the trees... BURYING C-4 CHARGES. In bushes. In snowdrifts. She crawls to woods' edge, peers out -- The motel stands solemn and bedraggled. Draws a sharp breath -- ! There's a LIT CANDLE in the window of 17. CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A gray-suited SENTRY. Poised on a wooded slope. He puts a walkie-talkie to his lips and says:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All clear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: out of nowhere. Lightning fast. Hand, clamped on mouth. In goes the knife. Deep. He burbles blood. Drops. Before he hits, Charly's already switched from knife to gun and moved on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charly appears from the shadows. Ghosts up to the window of #17 and peers in. Scans. Misses nothing. Crosses to the door, taps lightly. Watches the PEEPHOLE, a tiny pinprick of light. Abruptly darkened by a human eye -- She presses the silenced Beretta to the hole and fires. Sputs of splinters. From behind the door, a muffled thud. She goes to work on the lock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MINUTES HAVE PASSED Henessey lies prone, binoculars trained on the motel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind him, a tiny, sharp click--! TIMOTHY has a Skorpion machine pistol aimed at his head. The killer speaks into a radio unit, a single word -- TIMOTHY Bogey.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Christ, lady, what are you doing in there, playing fucking mah-jongg? *Move*.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! go the Kleig lights. BRILLIANCE, blinding -- CATCHES CHARLY coming out of 17. Pins her dead to rights. Unconscious DAUGHTER cradled in her arms. Tiny DOLL cradled in the kid's. Charly runs, as the ground around her erupts like a SHELLBURST.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shouting into his walkie-talkie, saying:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henessey watches, helpless and PANICKED, as Charly tumbles BACKWARD. Crashes through a CELLAR ACCESS, it splinters beneath her...! Plunges into blackness.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Take her alive, Perkins wants her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She hits, cushions the kid. Grunt of PAIN... THE DARKNESS EXPLODES into kaleidoscopic FLASHES OF GUNFIRE, Charly strafe it all. Blows through the clip, hits the lights: She's killed household items. BRICK WALLS, blasted. Rusty tools, faded signs -- THREE TEN-GALLON GAS CANS which she's managed to PERFORATE, good one, Charly... The gas comes bubbling out on burps and splatters, drenching the floor. Charly casts about for an escape route. Set into the brick wall, a huge steel DOOR. She flings it open -- MEAT LOCKER. Nothing there, no help. Eyes darting. Possessed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wafts down from above, then. Deadly serious:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I smell gasoline, you have a little accident...? I got plenty of matches up here. Bad way for a kid to go. Thirty seconds, think it over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stands in place, mind racing... Caitlin's DOLL. Regards her dully. Plastic smile like it knows a secret. CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as it descends into the bowl of a pipe... MR. PERKINS puffs mightily. Turns and favors CHARLY and HENESSEY with a thoughtful gaze, they're handcuffed to radiator... TIMOTHY straddles a nearby chair. Smiles and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He crosses to the fireplace, flips the match inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pause. Suddenly Charly's eyes go wide. She whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comprehension, dawning. She looks up in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perkins shrugs philosophically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charly and Henessey react, startled...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good to have you back again, Chuck.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, Colonel, you ought really to have stayed dead. You don't know the rules of the game anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No shit. Eight years ago, you send me to kill Daedalus and this clown. Now you're working *with* him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Budget cuts, remember? Congress blinded us in Eastern Europe, Central America. Across the board, an intelligence blackout. We had to recruit any eyes and ears we could find, even if it meant going to former targets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Budget cuts... oh, God. Is *that* what this is about...? The foot soldiers, the tanker truck... Fuck me, you're running a fundraiser!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll get all the money you want at the next budget hearing, won't you...? All you need is a major terrorist incident.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Interesting theory.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Theory, my ass. I think some terrorists were planning a strike. Bought supplies from Daedalus, that's how you knew they were coming... (eyes widening) No way. Don't tell me you're gonna sit there and let them go through with it, *just to get a budget increase*.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not without precedent. 1993, remember the World Trade Center bombing...? The CIA had advance knowledge, don't think they didn't. Worse, the diplomat who issued the terrorist's visa was CIA, they *facilitated* the bombing. Purely to justify a budget increase. Of course, they'd no way of knowing the terrorists would botch the job.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not gonna happen this time...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. This time, the terrorist event will come off precisely as planned. This time the terrorists can't muck it up... because we've killed them and taken over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: On the move. Our two heroes, shepherded across the compound. Timothy's casualness is belied by the presence of two dyspeptic GUARDS, each keeping a safe distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: approaches briskly, RIFLE across his shoulder. Holds out his hand:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Timothy studies it: C-4 CHARGE with remote detonation unit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The agent rushes off. Timothy looks at Charly reproachfully:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moves like lightning. WHACK-! Kidney shot. Charly stumbles, vision going black. Fights for balance. Henessey starts to react but a GUN MUZZLE stops him. Charly straightens. Grits her teeth, says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Timothy and the guards exchange looks. Cracking up, they can't believe it -- Charly's not laughing. Looks at Timothy with hooded, lifeless eyes:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Timothy lights a cigarette. Studies Charly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He casually points to the neighboring valley, where Christmas lights twinkle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pause. Charly summons herself. Her voice a dull rasp:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She shakes her head:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stares Timothy full in the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead silence. A pause... Then Timothy brays LAUGHTER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooting out loud. Tears, streaming... He manages to bring himself under control. Stops, gestures to the CELLAR ACCESS, the dark awaits...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charly fights to contain herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charly and Henessey are separated at gunpoint. A look passes between them. Henessey swallows hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charly goes through the opening.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Found these buried around the perimeter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Make sure you get all of them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chuck, you give me the fuck of my life then try to stick me, come back from the dead, whack my boss... No sense lyin', I'm miffed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So what's the plan? What's going out in the tanker?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the plan? I'm gonna die, I wanna know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You wanna know the plan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Santa Claus -- small town U.S.A. personified. We drive the chemical tanker in tonight, park it. Add a catalyst, chain reaction, it goes hot. We evacuate. The mix heats overnight, goes critical at 312 degrees Celsius. 8:00 Christmas morning... Main Street looks like a meteor strike.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you fucking insane? You're talking about 10,000 people!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Easy, Mitch. (to Timothy) How you gonna blame it on terrorists?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Those roads are treacherous this time of year. When we dump a car to the bottom of a ravine, with the corpse of Imn Al Rahman in it... get the picture?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen to me, Timothy. Please. Let my kid go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why? For old times' sake...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goddamn you, *look at her eyes*...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And why exactly should I do that...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (spits blood) Because they're yours, motherfucker.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That night in Paris, I got pregnant. The little girl's your daughter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Priceless. Can't believe it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kid's down there. What it is, Charly, they're gonna find you both frozen to death in the woods. Suicide pact.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's no risk, Timothy, *let her go*.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The freezer's downstairs, Charly. Let's get it done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll wait for you to rescue me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be just a minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The same CELLAR she occupied earlier. Timothy behind her, he wrinkles his nose in distaste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caitlin is sitting in a chair. Bundled in flannel, clutching her baby doll, the one Perkins bought for her. She looks up at Charly dully. Sucking her thumb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charly composes herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charly licks her lips. Easy, Charly, keep cool, she mustn't die afraid...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He points to the STEEL DOOR of the meat freezer. The guard opens it onto a gleaming silver CHAMBER. Timothy calmly adjusts the thermostat. Sub zero. The guard reaches for Caitlin's doll... Charly snatches it back. Face etched in disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He subsides, unable to meet her gaze. At which point, Timothy tosses her the WOODEN BOX.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want to ever be on the receiving end of the LOOK she gives him... Steps into the freezer, holding Caitlin. As the door starts to swing shut, she says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She flashes him her most DAZZLING smile -- The whole room lights up. She can do that. As the door erases her from view, a chill dances up Timothy's spine... because there was nothing resembling doubt on her face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Shit, this place is loaded with fumes, nobody light a fucking match. You check her for flammables?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugs) Checked her for colon cancer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mommy...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shhhhh. Mommy's here, it's okay. Safe and snug... what comes next, huh...? What's the next part?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...bug in a rug... man with white hair... says the same thing you say...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're going to take a nap together, Cate. You can have your dolly, and Mommy will be next to you, how's that? It'll be like bears in winter. When they get cold, see, they fall deep, deep asleep...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bears, yeah, yeah. Enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're murdering us both, cocksucker, let the kid have her fucking dolly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chuck, I'm not a total creep. I'll make you a deal, okay? There's a knife in that box. Now, you and the kid, you're going to freeze, *but* -- if you kill the kid *by your own hand*...? I won't kill your husband. Serious. direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charly fights to contain the beast. "Fuck you," slyly retorts the beast. She BOUNCES and caroms off the sides like a mad pinball -- THE TRUCK SMASHES DOWN And all the windows BLOW OUT concussively and the front tires go with a volcano CRACK-! as the beast goes canting to one side, ponderous, MASSIVE... It keels over on its side. Still doing fifty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Slows itself by TAKING OUT LIGHT POLES, shears them off like saplings. Whacks the side of the chapel. IMPACT. Keeps going... Charly is EJECTED from the cab. Pinwheels through space like a broken doll, bursts through a STAINED GLASS WINDOW.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The glass ruptures as she catapults through. Hits on her stomach, bounces. Slides to a stop, rolls over -- FLINGS herself aside just in time, as a towering ST. PETER SMASHES to earth an inch from her head, showers marble...! Concussion dies away. Silence. Echoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tanker slides, DETONATING planters one by one... Comes to rest in a central COURTYARD. Lies there, a hissing dinosaur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is still affixed to the truck's underbelly: *280 degrees*.

direction.raw_text: Charly, semi-conscious. Rolls onto her back, gasping. Stares at the gathered saints. Swallows hard. Sucking it up, preparing. Rolls to one knee, plants her foot... She's got to make that truck. On her feet now. Stumbling forward. One arm hugging her guts. Cross-eyed, so hard to focus... left foot, right foot, get it done, bitch, yes it's *supposed* to hurt that much, flings open the door and she's so brave that for a second we think she might make it. Timothy kicks her in the head. Charly flies back. Hits and SLIDES. Fetches up against a bannister, WHAM--! Timothy calmly shuts the door behind him. Consults his tiny gauge -- *297 degrees*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sheds his coat. Stows his gun. Removes a SWITCHBLADE. Drapes the coat on the bannister. Flicks open the knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He approaches, almost casually. Charly staggers erect. Adopts a killing stance. Instinct. She can barely stand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Call it four minutes to detonation. I got a chopper on the way, lots of time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, honey. Only four inches...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll feel me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: hears a garbled, pained voice over his headset:
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes out a bottle of Scotch. CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Point team leader, reporting... She's... incapacitated the truck... I'm damaged, sir, I believe I'm dying... Instructions...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Continue dying. Out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anthony, get me the President...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Charly and Timothy. They circle, two pros.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never watching the eyes, the eyes are liars, they watch the HANDS... The gathered saints look on, neutral.

direction.raw_text: His concentration never falters as he says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He LUNGES with the knife, she spins away -- He gets hold of one arm and FLINGS her, up and over...! She SAILS through space. Twists in mid-air. Lands like a cat. Almost. Staggers forward. They circle...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charly LAUNCHES herself. Avoids a stab at her throat, eats that for breakfast, spins, slams the knuckles of her right hand into Timothy's ribs. Busts one. He snarls, TRAPS her wrist: CRACK! Wrist, broken. She HISSES in pain, falls back GASPING. Circling again. Charly cannot walk a straight line.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You've lost a step, Chuck. Muscles never recovered from C-section, I'll bet. Am I right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please, man... She's only... eight... she's a beautiful little girl...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's a worthless bitch. I know it 'cause she came out of me.

dialogue.raw_text: It's called shock, Charly... Your body wants to go into shock...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fuck you, your breathing's lousy...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look at you. You're out of your motherfucking league, dearie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She looks up at him from sunken eyes shot through with red, and in those eyes we glimpse it; the DEMON, laughing... as Charly whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lunges with the knife...! She ducks, trips on purpose and HANDS HIM HER SHOULDER, all that's missing is the plate -- And WHAM. In goes the knife, cuts deep and Charly looks him in the eye and GRINS because sure enough, there's the bastard's KNEE, wide open... Boot-strikes, BAM--! Shears the knee, and Timothy HOWLS in agony. Stumbles backward into the bannister -- Grabs his coat. Brings out the gun, it GOES OFF--! Charly dives for cover. Rips the knife from her own shoulder and flings it. Takes him in the shoulder. Topples him back. BANNISTER. Up and over, flailing...! Drops from sight. Charly falls back. Pause. Sucking air. Sits down hard. Legs splayed. Looks down at herself, oh, God... There's a hole in her chest.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...You want a piece...? Take my shoulder.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The doors burst open and here she comes. Trauma, severe. Shock, blood loss -- She makes for the tanker. For her kid. Hitches. Staggers. Going on sheer guts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The PILOT brandishes his radio mic:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Got her. Heading for the tanker, thirty yards out. She's all over the place, something's wrong with her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Left foot, right foot, she's not running, she's falling in a straight line -- Reaches the tanker. Staggers against the inverted chassis. UTILITY BOX. Above her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She raises her gun. Fires. BAM-! Lock springs to pieces. CAITLIN tumbles to the pavement, dazed and confused. Casts about -- CAITLIN MOMMY...! She springs to her feet. Comes running and flings both arms around her mother. HUGS HER -- That one puts Charly out for a few seconds. PAIN, excruciating. Comes to her senses, swaying like a clothesline in a high wind...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charly grabs Caitlin's head. Turns it. Facing the TEMPERATURE GAUGE. Red numerals: *301 degrees*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caitlin hovers, torn. Charly summons a gutteral CROAK:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the end, Caitlin relents. RUNS, toward the surrounding woods... Charly watches her go. Nods, satisfied -- Collapses. Hits the tarmac and splays in a heap. Breath wheezing in and out. Already the pavement is staining red.

dialogue.raw_text: *Cover your ears*.

dialogue.raw_text: Run... get out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't go away again, Please...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The truck's a bomb... gonna blow up, RUN... I'm right behind you, go...

dialogue.raw_text: ...*Go and don't look back*...

direction.raw_text: As, within ten seconds of the command, she promptly DISOBEYS her mother, looks back -- Stops dead. There's a corpse underneath the truck. It isn't moving. It isn't breathing. It isn't laughing or crying... Or hurting, not anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bomb forgotten. Danger forgotten. Her tiny arms pumping, feet slapping pavement -- She returns to her mother. Grabs one knife-bloodied shoulder, oblivious of the wound. Jerks back and forth. Frenzied.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: *Mommy, no...*!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's okay. I'm sorry I left, please wake up, come on please...

direction.raw_text: . Cheek against the pavement. One lifeless eye STARES. Bloodshot and sightless.

direction.raw_text: Government vehicles, pulling up now. At the edge of the parking lot. 100 yards away, give or take. Numerous SEDANS. The Little Debbie panel truck. AGENTS crouch behind cars. Weapons trained on the wounded behemoth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The side door BURSTS OUTWARD and a limping figure emerges, frantically signaling for the chopper: TIMOTHY'S got murder in his eye. THE CHOPPER banks, coming in low as he hauls himself aboard.

direction.raw_text: He grabs an automatic rifle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, your shoulder -- TIMOTHY Fuck the shoulder, knee's worse. Just bring me around and hold her steady. I'm not leaving until I know the bitch is dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - UNDERNEATH THE TANKER She adheres to Charly's motionless form. Looking small and terrified. Whispers in her mother's ear. Soft and low:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Face contorted, she strikes out. Flails. HITS Charly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tears coursing in rivulets. Little fists clenched. Then -- It might be a trick of the wind. Tiny aspiration, not enough breath to fog a mirror...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A solitary tear appears in the wide-open staring eye. One fingernail, then. Scratches feebly. Toes, shifting. Seeking purchase. A HAND, planting itself... TEETH BARED, a rictus of pain... Rising up... *Standing*. Full height now, flexing one deadly arm. She hugs her daughter and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Overhead, the HOWLING of rotor blades. Charly gasps for breath. Cracks open the GUN... no bullets. Swell. Scans the pavement... There. THE MP-5 machine gun lies twenty feet from her. Twenty miles, same difference. Across the pavement, even farther away: Timothy's car. *305 degrees*. Charly swallows hard:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They break cover. Into the open. A WITHERING FIRE ERUPTS. Right at their feet...! Geysers of asphalt, shot skyward -- TIMOTHY sprays the blacktop from above. Ruthless. Charly goes insane. Lurches, crazed, to the cab of the truck. Thumbs the mike and says:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mommy, get up now. You just stop it, Mommy, you stop being a little baby. Stop it, you're not dead, I know you're not dead so you get up now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: *Don't you die*, you get up now, Goddammit...! Life is pain, you just get used to it, and stand up *right this minute*, Mommy. Life is pain, do it, you bitch. *Do it*.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...mommy... here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...You're grounded...

dialogue.raw_text: I'm gonna get the gun, you run for that car. We go on three, okay? One... Two... *Three*.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Somebody get that motherfucker off me! I got a kid here, I got my eight year-old daughter, *Jesus Christ*...! It's Christmas Eve, who are you *people*, fucking pull him off! Do you hear me...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . We don't know whose they are. We don't know where we are.

direction.raw_text: The temperature gauge: *308 degrees*. She clutches Caitlin. Shouting into the mic:

dialogue.raw_text: Distract him, for God's sake give me ten seconds, please, I'm begging somebody, anybody, *she's my daughter*...!

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Negative, ma'am, we understand your request, but we've decided to go ahead and let this play out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: At the wheel. Making a suicide run. Face a FRIGHT MASK of deadly purpose. We have no idea why someone who looks like him is alive.

dialogue.raw_text: Where are *you* going??
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Chopper again, SCREAMING in low and fast -- CHARLY dives, rolls -- Comes up with the MACHINE GUN and falls flat on her back, points it skyward:

direction.raw_text: She fires. Blows the chopper's TAIL ROTOR. The craft pitches to the side -- Dumps Timothy out the door. Flailing. Head over heels, he FALLS -- Lands atop the TANKER, right on the silver tank and *burns*. Actually SIZZLES at 310 degrees Celsius, steam pouring off him like a vampire in daylight, SHRIEKING--!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She watches as he slips from sight... off the tanker. SIRENS now, approaching. Wind, biting cold. Ground black and bloody in the moonlight...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Suck on it.

dialogue.raw_text: Die screaming, motherfucker.

direction.raw_text: powers across the lot, pedal to the metal. Followed at a distance of fifty yards by half a dozen squawling GOVERNMENT VEHICLES, flashers turning. Henessey stomps the brake. SLEWS to a stop, tires cooking...! KICKS open the passenger door as Charly collapses into the car, CAITLIN in her arms. The kid says:

direction.raw_text: He inadvertently smacks a light pole. SPARKS fly.

dialogue.raw_text: Hurry! The truck is a bomb!

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, yeah. What else, we got a fucking lightning rod on the roof...? No, Caitlin, *don't check*.

dialogue.raw_text: I think that's yours...

dialogue.raw_text: Right, sorry...

direction.raw_text: They have to drag Timothy inside the car. The engine ROARS as it leaps forward, trailing the other FIVE -- Scarred and hideous, he stares after Charly, screaming:

direction.raw_text: That's when the helicopter crashes. The pilot does everything but flap his arms -- Forget it. IT KEELS OVER. Rotor touches pavement -- Blows to pieces. They ALL go. Snapped off. Blown like rockets in every direction.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: *Somebody do her, somebody kill that fucking whore, kill her*!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as a rotor blade whistles right through the windshield of his car. Shears off his HEAD. Blows out the BACK in a shower of glass and hurtles onward, SPINNING out of control... Strikes the tanker. Boom. Imagine God in Monte Carlo. Tossing dice the length of a craps table. Now, imagine the dice are BURNING CARS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henessey flies out of the parking lot and INTO the WOODS as the firestorm RAGES TO HEAVEN behind him. Cars, heading his way -- AIRBORNE. Fights the wheel, swerving through the woods as all around him, FLAMING CARS crash down. BOUNCING into and out of the trees, peekaboo... Some go flying past OVERHEAD. Striking in front like meteors, GOUGING the earth. Caitlin screams:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henessey favors her with a foul look. CHARLY looks up and sees ANGELS flying overhead, trailing concrete... Then they're OUT OF THE WOODS. Car slingshots onto the highway and races forward, SAFE. Behind it, the sky is aglow, SNOWING fiery traces... Bits of earth, trees, pavement.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't hit the cars!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : As they roar out of town, we see burning woods and a CRATER approximately 150 yards in diameter -- St. Peter's Seminary no longer exists... CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henessey coasts to the side of the road and stops. He lays his head on the steering wheel, sucking air. Looks at Charly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charly offers him that soft, sad little smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henessey starts to fade... breathing labored... Reaches up... strokes Caitlin's hair. Smiles at her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slumps back in the seat. Gazing at Charly. A single tear runs from one bloodshot eye. He whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dies. Charly leans on the dash. Cries for awhile. For herself... for Henessey... for this Godawful planet, and everything else. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, can't drive... Are you okay...?

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...funny thing...? You aren't going to die... I am...

dialogue.raw_text: I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, gorgeous... know something... you got your mother's eyes... don't let... nobody tell you different...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Scared... to be nobody... without a ripple... please... remember me... (beat) ...Love you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: in the glow of a Winnie the Pooh nightlight. Next to her sleeping daughter's bed -- back to the very beginning of the film, it's been a long kiss goodnight. An elderly FARMER pokes his head in. She doesn't look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shadowy figure nods... Remains seated. Stays awhile in the dark. Keeping vigil. Snow slithers against the glass.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Um, Ma'am...? Ambulance is here. They'll be right in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . PERKINS emerges from a guest cottage, flanked by his aide Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry's FOOT comes down on a circular slab of STONE -- and a voice from the grave says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stops him in his tracks, stops him dead -- As CHARLY BALTIMORE steps from the nearby trees. Stands, twenty yards downrange. Beretta leveled at both of them. Two months, you barely notice the limp. She stands there in sleeveless top and short skirt and looks like a million. Thumbs a metal box, click-! A red ARMING LIGHT blinks on.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...They'll push for dismantlement of our apparatus in Chile, but we've got a degree of plausible deniability...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Stay very still.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good morning, I'm Charly. The slab you're standing on is actually a land mine. Keep your foot on the pressure plate, nothing happens. Step off the stone, we'll all be wearing you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: steps forward. The gun shifts. Targets him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She reaches in a pocket. Tosses him a cellular phone -- He catches it as though it were a live snake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He swallows hard. Looks to his aide... back to her... DIALS. Charly takes a deep breath. Scans the flowers, face placid. It's really quite lovely today. Maybe she'll start a garden. Perkins clicks off. Look at Charly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles. Shifts her aim and shoots the other guy. Perkins' eyes WIDEN in sudden realization. He LUNGES forward, grabs the aide, holding him up... desperately propping his dead weight atop the land mine...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Charly, I know we've treated you poorly, please, it was just business --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My terms are these. Call State and order full disclosure on your personal correspondence. Then disband Chapter, effective immediately. In exchange...? I won't shoot you, and I won't make you stand on that mine. I won't touch you. I won't touch you. I promise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You... you promise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's done. Now, you promise... you won't shoot me... won't make me get on the mine...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I promise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goddamn you, I can't hold him... You bitch... YOU FUCKING BITCH...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Henessey's CHRYSLER CONVERTIBLE has been restored to a cherry red. It purrs along the boulevard, Charly at the wheel. Hair blowing. She talks on the cellular phone:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind her a GOUT OF EARTH blows skyward. Showers the road a ways back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Mr. President, you have my assurance that Perkins' latest operation has been rendered beyond salvage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's not in the greatest shape either.

direction.raw_text: He speaks from the oval office, face grave:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I owe you an astounding debt of thanks, Colonel. Would it be impertinent to ask if you'd consider working for State again? The moneys involved would be substantial.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Out of the question. I've got a stack of papers to grade. Listen, before I go, I need a small favor...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SUBURBAN HOME - AKRON, OHIO - DAY Henessey's EX-WIFE stands in the open doorway, flanked by her son TODD. Two uniformed COPS speak solemnly:

dialogue.raw_text: #1 ...As I say, we can only apologize for the system, Ma'am, but it's confirmed that your husband is innocent of the crime for which he was imprisoned. This is a photograph of the actual criminal...
